number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								A space-RPG that is a mix between FTL, Guns of Icarus and quest based rpg. The game is fun, and the way to the official release shouldn't be long. That said, there are still bugs and glitches that has to be fixed and more depth to the game to be added. But the potential is there!The game consists of several classes, all of which have their own tasks to make the spaceship run smoothly. They have upgradable talents that will give perks to either themselves or to the ship. The engineer has control of power usage and core temperature, along with the systems on the ship such as weapons, shield and warp drive. The pilot maneuvers the ship. The controls takes some minutes to get used to, but becomes easy after flying around for a little time. The weapon specialist fires the big gun. Probably the easiest positions, but also very entertaining. Railgun, laser turret, missiles, nukes and more. The scientist is more like an electronic warfare operator. Cyberwarfare (infecting enemy ship systems with computer viruses), shield boosting and programming, and scanning of planets and ships. The captain is the big boss. He is in control of buying and selling components and equipment for the ship, has full economical control and makes the plans for where to go and what to do. Personally I think this role is a bit dull, as it consists of mostly just telling people what to do, without doing anything yourself (except from plotting in the course in the starmap). This is realistic, of course, but still the position I like the least. A good crew can be really fun to play with, and you dont even have to be 5 to play. AI exists, but I haven't really figured them out, and initially i find them to be quite crap as opposed to a player. Another similarity with Guns of Icarus I guess. tldr; fun co-op game with space exploration and upgradable ship and characters. Crossover between FTL/Guns of Icarus/RPG.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Pulsar is unlike any other co-op game I've ever played, since everyone's experience is their own.I learned how to play Engineer first just in case I wanted to kill my crew for the heck of it.I joined a crew that was seemingly a tiny bit dysfunctional. Decided "hey, Im gonna screw these guys over"Acting normal and such when I hear burning. Go to investigate. Entire life support room is on fire. I think nothing of it and put it out and repair the system.Keep plotting to kill crew until I be good guy again when the core is on fire. Think nothing of it since we just got out of combat.Another system catches on fire. Go to put it out. See our ten-year-old weapons officer walk away from the fire. Get suspicious. Tell no one.Going on our merry way when suddenly ship power goes out. Go to reboot system. Weapons officer is responsible. Captain was right about suspicions. Decide to not screw over crew.Later, I'm learning how to be capitan on my own ship, the Damrey.Sceince guy with no mic joins and is probably a noob, and is acting overly cheery.Going along when power goes out. Engie reboots it.Noob science is obvious culprit when he turns it off again and runs to captain's chair when we all go investigate.Tell science if he wants to get kicked he should do it again. He does it again.After this crew I got a drunk pilot and a weapons officer who played edgy music through his mic.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 2
Early Access Review
								I enjoyed this game thoroughly. Pilot was my first role (and the perspective this review is based on). I did read the entire manual before starting, though, so I understood the mechanics before starting (took about 30 minutes to read the manual). The physics of the ship are great. The ship drifts, gradually accelerates and reduces speed, and can move in all 8 directions (up, down, left, right, roll right/left, pitch up/down). Sometimes the enemy will shoot you with something huge and will spin the ship out of control - very crazy and hard to recoup from. At one point I hid behind a comet and would come out to give my gunner visual, take some damage, and duck back down before our shield went down. The enemy A.I maneuver in very smart ways. I was impressed.There are 5 classes: Captain, Pilot, Engineer, Scientists, and Weapons.Each class can perform the roles of each other and Captains have the option of using A.I. My adventure saw me on a ship with 2 others - a Captain and Engineer for a while. We eventually got a full ship. Many people joined and left. I started playing at 3 am CST and just stopped at 12 pm. These were random people. I did not go into this game with anyone else. I simply joined one of the open ships on the server browser. 2 of the people I adventured with are now on my steam.Adventuring in the game was seamless and fun. Players use warp drives to go to different star systems. Warping to different star systems sometimes prompts the captain to accept or deny a mission. Accepting a mission will show the players on galactic map which star system to go to accomplish the mission. Missions range from protecting a ship being attacked, salvaging / investigating a destroyed ship, and exploring a planet (There might be more currently or planned).Star systems usually contain one of the following: Nothing, A single comet with some enemies / friendlies, a planet, and we ran into something called an "infected" star system (very hostile) and we ran into a odd place that looked like ice crystals all around making piloting difficult - very tight spaces - where we picked up scrap to sell for money. Each star system has a different color aura. The infected are a mystery to me. They remind me of the flood from halo.Combat in this game is somewhat complicated but simple at the same time. As a pilot I did not get to see much of what was going on with the crew - however this is what I noticed / read / talked with the crew.The engines, guns, and other things necessary for a ship cause the core temperature of the ship to rise. This rising temperature has to be regulated by the engineer of the ship by altering how much power goes to what. For example - i was using thrusters a lot to maneuver around the comet to dodge enemy fire while our weapons guy was firing. This nearly caused overheating so the engineer cut the power to my thrusters by half causing my manueverability to suffer so that I would not overheat the core. Just before writing this we were running away from a fight, preparing to warp jump and I was at max thrust forward while using the smaller thrusters (meant for small movements) to get as much speed as possible. All the sudden all my engines shut off. I went into first person mode and all the lights in the ship were off (it gets very dark - you have flashlights) the crew was scrambling to put out fires (things catch on fire when the ship is taking damage from the enemy), repair equipment (things break too) and reboot the ship (it shut down due to overheating - mainly because of me).I decided to get off the piloting controls and grab my fire extinguisher and repair tool (it was already in my inventory) and go help - too late. We blew up.This may have been prevented if the scientist of the ship had the proper programs. Programs are essentially buffs or debuffs for the player ship or enemy ship.Luckily, the captain saved his spot. Saving works like this: The host of the server has the option to save the game state. Only the host may load and save. Pretty much, each host has their own ship. Anything a player buys for them self (there are trading stations - I bought a very good laser pistol and alcohol. Yes, you can get drunk. It makes your aim super inaccurate and gives you blurry vision) will be stored in their locker upon exiting the game.The captain of the ship allocates funds to the crew. You cannot buy things without the captain authorizing the funds. Pretty much, the game is a co-op game that does not require real people nor does it punish having real people. The host can play with whoever, whenever, and the host's progress is saved - the ship items and the crew items.This is a very good game. The immersion and teamwork are a type of fun I have found in only a few other games. What I really like, though, is the exploration aspect.I wanted to try some space exploration like No Mans Sky, but without the grinding. I wanted to play a game with teamwork and communication but I wanted a casual setting. This game offers both these things combined.If I were to lable this game it would be:Single player / Co-op, Space Exploration, Casual, Space Flight-Sim

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 1
Early Access Review
								I enjoy this game so much that I feel I want to give a review. I don't usually review anything.As far as I know, there are no other games that I can compare this with. But if you have a group of friends or relatives to play this with, I would recommend it more. i.e. The game is much better when 5 people are playing together and who play it properly. Pros:- Content - For a game that is in Beta, it does have a fair amount of content. We have been playing for about 10 hours on one game so far and we have gone around a quarter of the galaxy. We have not touched the sector commanders just yet. I think we will try one soon though.- Updates - Whenever a new update comes out, there is always plenty to add. Most recently, the new ship - Outrider - is absolutely brilliant. I would possibly recommend it to new players too as it's easy to move around and a good starter to research. Plus, the new Ice Train level is really good and took us a little while to complete.- Systems - I really enjoy playing as the Engineer. The ability to raise and lower power to keep the ship alive is great. The fact that each change actually changes something in real time is brilliant. So often do you reduce a bit of power from Science and everyone is moaning that they no longer can see that enemy. So you take a bit from Engineering and now the Pilot is struggling to turn around. Then the enemy knocks out Life Support and Oxygen starts to go down. So once that's fixed the core has gone into emergency cooldown. - Fantastic!- Role Playing - To play with a group all talking to eachother and actually playing their roles properly is so good. What I mean is: The pilot flys the ship, he isn't manning the turret while the Captain is flying. Meanwhile, the Weapons Specialist is on the Bridge scanning the enemy. (Unless that's how you personally play...) But if everyone does their role and reports to the Captain, it runs smoothly and everyone does their job in the event of an emergency, it is very satisfying.- Multiplayer - If you do find yourself playing alone, there are usually a handfull of games to join.- AI - Yes, I put AI on the pros... I feel personally that the recent update where you have a lot of control over the AI has made it more bearable. The Captain can now add their own orders and change what the AI do when you give those orders. It's not perfect, but the developers know that. This new way of organising your Bots has made the AI a lot better.Cons:- Content - When you have been playing for a little while, the same missions start popping up and you know exactly where to go and who to talk to. With more content and a greater selection of starter missions to choose from would this be overcome. This is coming though so, great!- Updates - Sometimes they don't come soon enough...- Systems - Some systems are not complete yet. On occasion will you get something pop up and it's not in the game yet. E.g. Auxiliary system: Climate Control.- Graphics - I personally like the graphics. But for people who have played uber realistic space sim games, the graphics are not a comparison. (Not that the graphics are bad though...)This is by no means an exhaustive list...---Would I recommend this game?Absolutely!!! For the price you are paying, you will have quite a lot of hours of gameplay in different ships and different people and different roles. E.g. Currently there are 6 ships and 5 different roles - 30 different games?? More on the way!!

content:
Posted: February 15
Early Access Review
								Quick Review after owning this for about 6 months - "BUY THIS GAME"10/10 would turn off crew's oxygen supply to power sheilds again (and the fact you can do this for strategy purposes totally blew me away)The creative ideas that went into this game astound me:(some as to not spoil this)IDEA! - Wanna fix your ship?- no problem, just shout the engineer to power down the shields so the hull can be repaired!         - oh wait, He's just the janitor that found the engineer's uniform and has no idea how to do that.. or put out the fires on the ship mid battle.. or the process to turn the shields back on without turning off the power to all the ships many computers.. and weapon systems.. and accidentally ejects the engine in a blind panic while the scientist is yelling at him.. then the pilot loses patience and goes "space nuts" - starts firing his pistol at the glass at the front of the ship while hammering on the distress beacon like he's practicing to survive the Torture Scene in a Metal Gear Solid game.- Learn the engineer role yourself and restart the game as the engineer - sit with a crew while a new pilot warp into new territories to discover an intergalactic hull eating virus that causes everyone else on the ship to start yelling, "engineer you noob, get the warp core charged now!!!" - tell the captain, "I just can't do it, I don't have the power" - because the captain spent all the money on the giant laser that the weapons specialist was pestering him about last time you docked and forgot the fuel/core charger upgrade... watch with a sense of "I told you so" as the weapon's specialist clutches himself in a corner over the fact he never got to use his big gun he always polished in the creeping realisation that in seconds, his life is over...--> The most underrated, under played game I have ever enjoyed. The one thing that would make this better is more people playing it and more Dev time.I hate to say this but.. and I apologise in advance... "I would even be happy if EA bought this team/game" (If it meant a bigger team working on this project continually pumping in content for full price expansions.)Would happily pay full price for a larger team working on this project as it's genius that's being totally overlooked.It did to space games what Vampire the Masquerade: bloodlines did for vampire games (Introduced gameplay never before used, set the bar crazy high and then went totally unnoticed and became a cult legend only to be pined over by adoring fans 12 years and counting.. wishing.. just what if.. someone made a game this good again..)

content:
Posted: January 25
Early Access Review
								I backed the kickstarter on this game for a significant chunk of change and have played it on and off ever since it first came into pre alpha. I do not regret my purchase.Here is my abridged oppinion of the game:It is good over all and development is steadily improving the game.Im a big fan of the artistic style, music, and the teamwork/exploration oriented gameplay.The community behind the game is also rather friendly and welcoming.My only big complaint is that there is no ability to make the player-character jump. (at least the last time I checked that is), instead you will require a jetpack which for some reason is only available on one of the ship classes, which limits the exploration you can do if you do not choose said ship.My other complaint is that Foxxy is no longer to be found anywhere. :cI keep coming back to this game after leaving it for several months. And every time I do I am pleasantly surprised by the new content.The crew AI is not very smart, and not easy to command either; however the last time I played they improved significantly and I expect them to get better in the future.Sadly I've yet to have the chance to play this game to the fullest as I've never had all 4 of my friends online and willing at the same time to play with. That one is on me however.Required perhipherals to play this game properly:More friends with the game than I have.A Discord server or simmilar and associated pehripherals (mics for everyone, etc.)

Early Access Review
								I love this game so much! I bought it before it was released on Steam and have really seen this game develop. It has many faults but the developers are usally quick to respond and the fix the issue so you can have a better playtime. Its amazing how you can walk around a bridge and manage different controls and stations such as pilot or engineering! The AI has also developed in a lot of ways since the beginning, now you can give them custom orders to follow that they couldn't carry out before hand. I would give this game a 10/10 rating for any space nerd / geek like myself but it still needs a lot of work to be done on it!

Posted: April 10
Early Access Review
								AMAZING game. As long as the players play their respective roles properly, it's a really great experience. It can be highly technical if you want it to be, but if you don't, it can also just be messing around. If you like being strategic and logical, go for the captain or engineer class. Like driving games? Go for the pilot. Just want to shoot things with big lasers in space? Use the weapon specialist. It really does have something for just about anyone.
